title.narrative: Community Forestry in the Maya Biosphere Reserve

description.narrative: ICCO Cooperation, with the Mesoamerican Alliance of Peoples and Forests (AMPB), works to strengthen the land rights and forest governance of communities that inhabit the Multiple Use Zone of the Maya Biosphere Reserve in Guatemala. These communities have developed an innovative forest management model to create sustainable livelihoods and also, preserve the forests from wild fires, illegal logging and other threats. This project is financed by CLUA with co-financing from ICCO and other partners.

comment.narrative: ACOFOP continued working their members during 2018. Nevertheless, two organizations presented technical plans to manage forestry concessions: Sociedad Civil Maya del Norte and Sociedad Civil Amigos del Bosque.
